intro: Physaria hemiphysaria subsp. lucens, commonly known as the brightleaf bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant is characterized by its bright yellow flowers and inflated, bladder-like seed pods. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its subspecies status reflects subtle differences in morphology and distribution compared to other Physaria species.
